title: ICE: thread 'main' panicked at 'index out of bounds: the len is 0 but the index is 1', /usr/src/rustc-1.32.0/src/libcore/slice/mod.rs:2463:10

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
This has never happened to me before, but now it happens if I run `cargo test` a second time.  Unfortunately, I don't know what causes it, I'm just working on my project as usual.  This is rustc 1.32 as packaged by Debian/testing as of May.

Running `cargo clean -p sequoia-openpgp` didn't help, only removing the target directory helps.

```
-*- mode: compilation; default-directory: "~/repos/pep/sequoia/" -*-
Compilation started at Tue May 14 12:46:50

cd ~/repos/pep/sequoia &&
                      RUST_BACKTRACE=1 cargo test -p sequoia-openpgp -- &&
```
